questions.question: Which sentence expresses uncertainty about someone's location?
options: He might be in the library studying.
He is in the library studying.
He goes to the library every day.
He will be in the library.
questions.answer: He might be in the library studying.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'She looks tired. She _____ have stayed up all night.'
options: might
could
must
might have

questions.question: Which of these implies a possible explanation for something?
options: The lights are off. They may have left already.
The lights are off. They left already.
The lights are off. They must leave.
The lights are off. They leave already.
questions.answer: The lights are off. They may have left already.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that shows possibility without certainty in the present.
options: He could be working from home today.
He will be working from home today.
He works from home every day.
He must be working from home today.
questions.answer: He could be working from home today.

questions.question: Identify the option that correctly expresses a future possibility.
options: They might go to the concert if they finish early.
They go to the concert every week.
They must go to the concert tonight.
They are going to the concert right now.
questions.answer: They might go to the concert if they finish early.
